results.title: Black Mirror: Bandersnatch
results.creator_credit: Charlie Brooker, Russell McLean, Caroline Harris, Catrin Meredydd, David Slade and House of Tomorrow
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2018
results.brief_description: In 1984, a young programmer begins to question reality as he adapts a dark fantasy novel into a video game. A mind-bending tale with multiple endings.

constellations_other.name: The power of alternate endings
constellations_other.description: This Constellation about alternate perspectives, dream states, sitcoms and spin-offs was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

results.title: Black Mirror
results.brief_description: A contemporary reworking of The Twilight Zone format that taps into our collective unease about our world, particularly our relationship to technology, Black Mirror explores the everyday dystopia we may already be living in.

constellations_other.name: Good vibrations
constellations_other.description: Since its invention, the humble theremin has been used in a number of different ways to evoke all sorts of strange sounds and moods.

constellations_other.name: The perils of new technology
constellations_other.description: Explores our fascination with, and our anxiety surrounding, new technology, which is something that can bring about significant cultural change but also danger.

constellations_other.name: The entire history of you
constellations_other.description: Bellingcat is a journalism collective using social media platforms and surveillance footage for their investigations.

results.description:
A contemporary British re-working of The Twilight Zone with stories that tap into the collective unease about our modern world.

Over the last ten years, technology has transformed almost every aspect of our lives before we’ve had time to stop and question it. In every home; on every desk; in every palm - a plasma screen; a monitor; a smartphone - a black mirror of our 21st Century existence.
description_for_label:

results.title: Black man down
results.creator_credit: Sam Watson, Bruce Redman and Bill McCrow
results.brief_description: ‘Black man down’ is a perilous journey into the Aboriginal psyche. It is a journey to the roots of time that expands and pulses with dark, mysterious energies. A young warrior, alone in a prison cell, is plagued and confronted by the ghosts of his past and spirits of the land. Death calls to him with a silken tongue, the sprits urge him to live….

results.title: Black man's houses (A)
results.creator_credit: Steve Thomas, John Moore, Australian Film Commission and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: More than a hundred years after the Tasmanian Aborigines were declared extinct, their descendants set out to reclaim the lost graves of their ancestors on Flinders Island in Bass Strait. The neglected burial site at Wybalenna was, in the 1830’s, Australia’s first segregated Reserve, under the directorship of George Augustus Robinson and is now the battleground which divides a community. The film raises difficult questions about what constitutes Aboriginality today, and how colonial attitudes still linger on. Winner Best Australian Film at the Melbourne Film Festival.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steve Thomas, John Moore, Australian Film Commission and Open Channel Productions

The film raises difficult questions about what constitutes Aboriginality today, and how colonial attitudes still linger on. Winner Best Australian Film at the Melbourne Film Festival.

results.title: Black Man's Houses
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Co-operative Limited and Steve Thomas
results.brief_description: Black Man’s Houses tells a dramatic story of the quest by Aboriginal people to reclaim the graves of their ancestors, who were exiled at Wybalenna on Flinders Island by the Van Diemen’s Land government, against a background of racism and denial.

constellations_other.name: Black documentary and truth telling
constellations_other.description: Essie Coffey was a trailblazer of Indigenous filmmaking, being the first Aboriginal woman to direct a documentary. The film spotlights the outspoken voice Coffey utilised to convey the realities faced by Aboriginal people and to encourage resistance to assimilation.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Open Channel Co-operative Limited and Steve Thomas
results.description: In 1832 the government of Van Diemen’s Land sent the last Aboriginal resistance fighters into exile at Wybalenna on Flinders Island, bringing an end to the Black War and opening a new chapter in the struggle for justice and survival by Tasmanian Aboriginal people. Black Man’s Houses tells a dramatic story of the quest by Aboriginal people to reclaim the graves of their ancestors against a background of racism and denial. Documenting a moving memorial re-enactment of the funeral of the great chief Manalargenna, the film also charts the cultural strength and resilience of his descendants as they are forced to fight for recognition in a society that is not ready to remember the terrible events of the past.
description_for_label: In 1832 the government of Van Diemen’s Land sent the last Aboriginal resistance fighters into exile at Wybalenna on Flinders Island, bringing an end to the Black War and opening a new chapter in the struggle for justice and survival by Tasmanian Aboriginal people. Black Man’s Houses tells a dramatic story of the quest by Aboriginal people to reclaim the graves of their ancestors against a background of racism and denial. Documenting a moving memorial re-enactment of the funeral of the great chief Manalargenna, the film also charts the cultural strength and resilience of his descendants as they are forced to fight for recognition in a society that is not ready to remember the terrible events of the past.

results.title: Black Magic (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This is a film about sport and top Aboriginal sportsmen. It is predominantly an account of the creative use of sport made by the Noongar people of Western Australia’s south-west to advance their status. Through interviews with top sportsmen like the Krakouer brothers in the Victorian Football League and Archie Jones, the runner of the 1920s, the film establishes that the motivation to succeed in sport arises from a moral desire to be accepted and recognised.

results.title: Black Lives Matter demonstration in London
results.brief_description: BlackLivesMatter started appearing online after a white man was acquitted of killing unarmed black teenager Trayvon Martin in 2012. It has since evolved beyond a hashtag to become a worldwide movement used to unite activists and hold authorities to account.

results.title: Black Island
results.creator_credit: Ben Bolt, Carole K. Smith and Children's Film Foundation
results.brief_description: A children’s adventure film about two young boys, Michael and Joe, who find themselves stranded on a remote island with a couple of escaped convicts. Cast includes Martin Murphy, Mikael Salomon, Michael Elphick, Frank Leigh, Allan Surtees, Norman Tipton.
